==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
Originally an {{Han compound|石|t1=rock|又|t2=hand|ls=ic|nocap=y}} — hand measuring a piece of rock. Also a {{liushu|psc|nocap=y}}, with {{och-l|石}} as a phonetic component. {{lang|zh|石}} is then corrupted into {{lang|zh|⿸广廿}}.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'' considers it to be a {{Han compound|庶|c1=p|又|c2=s|ls=psc|nocap=y}}.

Compare {{och-l|庶}} and {{och-l|席}}.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m-twa||handspan}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|མཐོ||span; span of thumb and middle finger}}, {{cog|my|ထွာ||to measure by a handspan; a quarter yard}}, {{m|my|အထွာ||handspan; quarter yard}}, {{m|my|တွက်||to consider, to reckon; to calculate; to refuse to do things because others would not}}, {{m|my|အတွက်||calculation; because of; for the sake of}}. It is unclear whether {{cog|mkh-pro|*cɗaʔ||span; handspan}} (whence {{cog|mnw|ဍ|tr=daˀ||to measure by spans of thumb and middle finger}}) is related. Related to {{och-l|圖|to plan; to consider; plan; map}}.
